Der Eintritt in eine gymnasiale Maturitätsschule erfolgt mehrheitlich im neunten Schuljahr und dauert in der Regel vier Jahre. Bei einem dreijährigen Maturitätslehrgang (Eintritt im zehnten Schuljahr) muss im neunten Schuljahr auf der Sekundarstufe I eine gymnasiale Vorbildung erfolgen

The @use of critical thinking in social science textbooks of high school: a field study of Fars province in Iran
Seyed Ahmad Hashemi, PhD, Lamerd Branch, Islamic Azad University, Iran

This study aims at investigating the use of critical thinking in high school social science textbooks based on Fars Province teachers' attitudes in order to present a model for textbook development. To achieve this goal, the use of the following skills in the social science textbooks was analyzed: reasoning, questioning, assessment of examples and statements, group work, interpretation, true judgment about issues, analysis and evaluation, logicality, and explicitness. It is a field study which was conducted in several high schools of Fars Province in Iran. The population of this study included 568 social science teachers. The sample was selected based on the stratified random sampling procedure so that 153 teachers participated in this study. The data were collected using a forty-four-item questionnaire based on Likert-scale, which was developed and validated by the researcher himself and some experts. The reliability coefficient was also estimated as 0.86. The data were analyzed through descriptive statistics (frequency, percentage, standard deviation, and coefficient of variations) and inferential statistics (Chi-square and Kruskal-Wallis Non-parametric tests). The result showed that the teachers of the Social Studies Textbook evaluated assessment of examples and statements, and analysis and evaluation skills as not satisfactory respectively. They evaluated the other skills as fairly satisfactory. Teachers of Sociology Textbook 1 evaluated explicitness, assessment of examples and statements, analysis and evaluation, and interpretation skills as not satisfactory respectively. They also evaluated other skills as fairly satisfactory. Teachers of Sociology Textbook 2 evaluated explicitness as not satisfactory, logicality as satisfactory, and other skills as fairly satisfactory. Therefore it is possible to rank order the social science textbooks of high school as satisfactory and not satisfactory with regard to the use of critical thinking. In other words, Sociology Textbook 2, Social Studies Textbook, and Sociology Textbook 1 were ordered on a continuum of satisfaction from satisfactory to unsatisfactory, respectively.

Tasks in history textbooks in Serbia at the end of the 19th and in the first half of the 20th century
hrsg. von Eva Matthes und Sylvia Schütze

Dieser Beitrag befasst sich mit der Zeit der großen und oftmals dramatischen Veränderungen, die das Königreich Jugoslawien am Ende des 19. und in der ersten Hälfte des 20. Jahrhunderts erfuhr. Im Jahre 1878 war der serbische Staat auf dem Berliner Kongress international anerkannt worden. Nach dem Ersten Weltkrieg wurde 1918 als gemeinsamer neuer Staat das Königsreich der Serben, Kroaten und Slowenen (ab 1929: Jugoslawien) gegründet. Die Veränderungen in der politischen Organisation bedeuteten auch die Einführung einer neuen Weltanschauung, die sich auf die Wahrnehmung der nationalen Nähe der drei Nationen gründete, deren Namen symbolisch in der Bezeichnung des Staates erwähnt wurden. Mit der Einführung der Diktatur im Jahre 1929 wurde die jugoslawische Idee im Staatsnamen noch stärker betont. Die Veränderungen auf politischem und staatlichem Gebiet hatten Auswirkungen auf den Bereich der Bildungspolitik, die als wirksames Instrument zur Unterstützung der politischen Ziele angesehen wurde. Auch die Didaktik und die auf ihr basierenden Lehrbücher hatten diesem Zweck zu dienen. Unter Berücksichtigung des historischen und sozialen Kontextes wird im Folgenden eine vergleichende Analyse der Aufgaben in Geschichtsbüchern der drei Länder vorgenommen. Der Schwerpunkt liegt dabei mehr auf inhaltlichen als auf methodischen Aspekten. Es soll insbesondere der Frage nachgegangen werden, welche Probleme in den Büchern (für Grund- und Mittelschulen) behandelt werden und inwiefern sich darin entweder der tatsächliche Zustand spiegelt oder aber bildungspolitische Ziele zum Ausdruck kommen.

Exercises in primary school textbooks during the first two decades of the Franco Dictatorship (1939-1959)
hrsg. von Eva Matthes und Sylvia Schütze

In diesem Beitrag geht es um zwei Textsorten in Schulbüchern für die Elementarstufe, die mit Unterricht und Schulpraxis unmittelbar zusammenhängen: (1) Aufgaben und (2) Empfehlungen bzw. Anweisungen für Lehrkräfte, wie sie den Lernprozess fördern können. Dazu wurden elf verschiedene Schulbücher aus vier unterschiedlichen und weit verbreiteten Schulbuchgattungen untersucht, die während der ersten 20 Jahre der Franco-Diktatur in Gebrauch waren. Sowohl an den Aufgaben als auch an den Handlungsvorschläge für Lehrkräfte lassen sich drei zentrale Dinge erkennen: (1) die pädagogische und didaktische Relevanz, die der emotionalen Dimension gegeben wird; (2) besondere Merkmale von Aufgaben und Anweisungen bei verschiedenen Textgattungen; und (3) eine Typologie schriftlicher und mündlicher Aufgaben. Sowohl die Aufgaben als auch die Handlungsvorschläge zeigen deutlich, was die Autoren als das jeweils lernenswerte Wissen und die anzueignenden Fähigkeiten ansahen. Entsprechend wählten sie dafür bestimmte Inhalte aus den Büchern aus. Außerdem zeigt die Analyse, wie diese Aufgaben auszuführen waren. Dadurch lassen sich Informationen über Didaktik und Lehrmethode sowie die dahinter stehenden pädagogischen Konzeptionen gewinnen.

Aufgaben zum Thema Bundesrepublik Deutschland in Staatsbürgerkundebüchern der DDR in den siebziger und achtziger Jahren
hrsg. von Eva Matthes und Sylvia Schütze

This paper analyses how the topic Federal Republic of Germany is dealt with in tasks of civics schoolbooks of the German Democratic Republic in the seventies and in the eighties. It asks which aspects of the Federal Republic of Germany are treated in which way in the separate tasks, if there are changes in the two decades, and if the thinking in concepts of friends and enemies can be found in the tasks. In the methodology of the GDR for civics four principles are specified: scientific basis, partiality, closeness to life, and problem-orientation  each of them based on the interpretation of Marxism-Leninism by the SED.

Aufgaben zum Thema DDR in Sozialkundebüchern der Bundesrepublik Deutschland in den siebziger und achtziger Jahren
hrsg. von Eva Matthes und Sylvia Schütze

This article deals with the question which assignments with regard to the topic GDR were given to pupils in schoolbooks for civics in the Federal Republic of Germany from the end of the sixties up to the end of the eighties. The school subject civics (also called politics or social studies) has always been to give the pupils  amongst others  an understanding of the values of the free democratic basic order of the FRG. One of its topics up to 1989/90 was also the other Germany with its socialist order. As there were some substantial alterations in the relationship between the FRG and the GDR in the seventies and in the eighties  positive ones like the Basic Treaty from 1972 and negative ones , the article describes which contents with regard to the DDR were dealt with in the assignments and whether the pupils were only mere recipients of a conviction regarded as correct, or whether they were entitled to an independent debate about questions of values and directions, i.e. which didactical conceptions can be conceived behind the assignments.

Arbeitsfragen in deutschen und in französischen Geschichtsschulbüchern

In the second half of the 19th and at the start of the 20th century, much fewer tasks were available in German history schoolbooks than in French history schoolbooks. In France, more task-related questions were asked in lower school system books than in higher school system ones. Today, however, you will find these tasks in the history books of both countries. In Germany, more tasks were established in the wake of the so-called curricular change (curriculare Wende) in the 1960s/70s. In line with that development, history work books (Arbeitshefte) in Germany presented many tasks to their students, whereas this was not the case in France. In order to explain these findings in both countries, one has to rely on mere suppositions. Since ancient times, books for instruction, which are based on questions and answers, have existed. Tasks in schoolbooks are therefore part of this tradition. The type of questions then and today is examined in this article as well. Until 1918, the questions mostly aimed at dates and facts. Nowadays, they are not only about contextual information, the pupils comprehension, and their abilities to transfer knowledge, but also about methodological competence. They thus mirror a changing understanding of didactics.

Förderung von Argumentationskompetenzen in aktuellen Geographieschulbüchern

Argumentation belongs to the central cultural techniques of our society needed to solve conflicts peacefully, make negotiations and enforce personal interests. As knowledge is individually linked and understood, argumentation is of great importance in the context of learning processes at school. Recent learning theories describe learning as constructive process. Here, assessment and evaluation of older convictions and insights play a central role  against the background of new perceptions and observations. In the classroom, linking of older knowledge with new insights happens mainly during communication and argumentation. Accordingly, the emphasis of teaching should not only lie on facilitating factual knowledge, but also on the realization of ways to confirm, expand and produce knowledge. This can be achieved by means of argumentation. This article presents results of a school book analysis, evaluating quantity and quality of argumentative tasks.

The @secret identity of a biology textbook: straight and naturally sexed

While education communities have well defined commitments to protect their learners from oppressive instructional materials, discourses of science education are often left unexamined. This analysis/critique employs queer theory as a perspective to look at how one widely used textbook in Ontario schools conceptualizes notions of gender and sexuality. Results indicate the use of discourses that promote exclusively heteronormative constructions of sexuality along with sex/gender binaries. Challenging such oppressive misconceptions of sex/gender and sexuality is discussed.

Learning to communicate in a globalized world: to what extent do school textbooks facilitate the development of intercultural pragmatic competence?
a journal of language teaching and research in Southeast Asia
publ. by the Seameo Regional Language Centre

Although a key component in English language teaching programs, English textbooks have been criticized for not offering classroom learners adequate opportunity for learning authentic language (Bardovi-Harlig, 2001; Grant and Starks, 2001; Wong, 2002; Vellenga, 2004). This is because instead of making use of language samples that native speakers actually produce, many textbooks have drawn on native speakers intuition about language use, which might not always be reliable (Wolfson, 1989a). This article reports on the finding of a study which aims to analyze and evaluate the pragmatic content of a recently developed series of textbooks intended for use in Vietnams upper-secondary schools. Specifically, the article examines how speech acts are linguistically presented in the textbooks and whether adequate contextual and meta-pragmatic information is provided to facilitate the learning of these speech acts. The article also draws implications regarding the writing of ESL/EFL materials for developing intercultural communicative competence in the context of English as a Global Language.

Baselines for the preparation of electronic textbooks
revija za management, informatiko in kadre ; journal of management, informatics and human resources

The NAUK group (Advanced Learning Blocks group; http://www.nauk.si) is engaged in the development of theoretical and practical concepts of ICT use in all levels of education. Recently, the proposed introduction of electronic textbooks (e-textbooks) has become a major topic nationwide in Slovenia. There are multiple dilemmas to be solved, e.g. what a modern e-textbook is, what it should include, in what way should it differ from conventional textbooks, what tools and technologies should be used for its creation, etc. This paper attempts to make recommendations, which we believe should be followed by all the authors of e-textbooks.

Knowledge and discourse in secondary school social science textbooks
Teun A. van Dijk; Encarna Atienza
an interdisciplinary journal for the study of text and talk

Within the framework of an interdisciplinary project on epistemic strategies in text and talk, this article examines such strategies in a (Spanish) secondary school textbook on social science. After a summary of current insights into the theory of knowledge in philosophy, psychology and linguistics, it is shown how discourse presupposes and expresses knowledge, with special emphasis on discourse processing and learning from text and its applications in education. The specific aim of this article is to study in some detail how exactly new knowledge is formulated in pedagogical discourse, and how old knowledge (generic knowledge of the world, knowledge learned before, etc.) is presupposed in a lesson on migration. We thus are able to describe the categories of, and the functional relations between, old and new knowledge, as discursive manifestations of underlying cognitive strategies of teaching and learning. It was also observed that in textbooks what is purported to be presented as knowledge often has an ideological basis.
